She buys and sells Malta Guinness, cooking oil, Fanta, etc. and intends to use her loan to purchase 3 boxes of Malta Guinness from the depot at the wholesale price. She envisions making an average monthly profit of GHS 600 that will be reinvested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

The other members sell fish and metal utensils.

loans.use: To purchase 3 boxes of Malta Guinness from the depot at the wholesale price.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana, age 27, is a hardworking married lady. She is involved in the business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family income. She is a very talented lady and makes enough income to meet her household expenses. She is the mother of seven children and all are school going.

Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. Farzana hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz, age 37, is a married woman and a mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession but his income is insufficient for their family expenditure. To meet her household expenditures, six years ago she started stitching clothes at her home. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Due to lack of availability of funds Shahnaz is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. So she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs 20,000. She intends to use this loan amount to buy spools of threads along with packs of buttons, laces and zippers. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 34-year old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the past four years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, Jamila requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Safiya is a 43-year-old married woman and mother of five children. It was very tough for Safiya to manage her household needs with her husband's small income. Therefore she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose she started her business of cloth sales.  She buys cloths of different varieties from the wholesale market and then sells them in her area. 

Safiya has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her 3rd loan cycle and has applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000. This will help her to purchase more variety of printed cloths in various colors and designs, taking into account the taste and choice of her customers.  Safiya is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: buy cloths to resell

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra is married with no children. She lives with her husband and her elderly parents in an apartment. Alexandra works as an accountant and has a stable income. On the other hand she can not save enough to fix her apartment. Alexandra is asking for a loan to help her put new wallpaper and new floors in her apartment.

Alexandra loves her parents, her job and is thankful for the opportunity to receive this loan.

loans.use: to put new wallpaper and new floors in her apartment

loans.name: Chos

texts.en:
Chos is a 52-year-old married woman from the Tboung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She lives in a simple house with her husband and three unmarried children. Chos’s main income comes from agriculture and the construction industry. Aside from farming activities, she follows her husband to work at construction sites to help earn income to cover their living costs. She has taken on much adversity in her life because she wants to provide a better lifestyle for and educate her children.

She has requested a loan of 500 U.S. dollars, which she will use to build a latrine because currently there is no latrine in the house. This loan will help her family members become healthier and also benefit the surrounding environment by keeping it clean and freer of disease. She is thankful to Kiva lenders for supporting her loan.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en: Suzana is a 43-year-old married mother of three children. She has been working in her convenience store for fifteen years. Her business is a very important source of her family's living.  That's why she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a car necessary for her business and family needs. This car will facilitate her business through visiting several wholesale markets and buying the best offers found.  She hopes that in the future she can expand her business more and more to provide her family and customers with the necessary needs.

loans.use: buy a car for her business and family

loans.name: Oliver's Group

texts.en:
Oliver is 17 years old and lives in the town of Mityana, in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her market stall business, where she sells fresh foods. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more kinds of produce, like cassava, beans and bananas. The new things to sell will help Oliver to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for her younger siblings. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to add more kinds of produce, like cassava, beans and bananas

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana, de 61 años,es soltera y tiene 2 hijos que educó sola, gracias a su perseverancia y algunos sacrificios logró convertirlos en personas de bien pero ellos ahora son independientes por eso vive solo con su nieta en su casa propia. Susana se dedica a la venta de frutas y productos regionales. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano en su puesto que tiene instalado en el frontis de su vivienda. Su trabajo consiste en ofrecer al público las más frescas y saludables frutas como naranjas, plátanos, limones, papayas y otros. Lleva en este negocio 4 años y trabaja sola. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que su tiempo laboral culmina al mediodía y eso le permite descansar por las tardes o dedicar su tiempo libre a otras actividades del hogar. Le esta yendo muy bien en su negocio ya que genera muchos ingresos económicos para su familia.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.800 soles y se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará frutas como, naranjas, plátanos, papayas y otros para ponerlos a la venta en su puesto.
texts.en:
Susana, 61 years old, is single and has 2 children whom she educated on her own thanks to her perseverence and some sacrifices along the way. Her children are now independent and Susana lives with one of her grandaughters in her own home. Susana works selling fruits and other regional products. She works every day starting very early in the morning, selling fruit from her stand which she has installed in front of her home. Her work consists of offering her clients the freshest and healthiest fruits such as oranges, bananas, limes, papayas and others. She has worked selling fruit for 4 years and works alone. She really enjoys what she does, especially since her work ends around noon which gives her time to rest in the afternoons or dedicate herself to housework. Her business is going very well and she generates enough income to support her family. 

Susana is currently asking for a loan of 800 Soles, and she is very grateful for the financial support that she has received in order to get ahead with her business. She has promised to repay all loan installments on time. With this new loan, she will buy fruits such as oranges, bananas, papayas and others, in order to sell them from her stand.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as oranges, bananas, papayas, and other regional products

loans.name: Denisse

texts.es:
Denisse, de 30 años es una mujer admirable. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos en su casa propia.  
Denisse se dedica a la venta de queso y sus estudios de Administración de empresas en una universidad reconocida de la ciudad.  En la altura de su pueblo, tiene una granja, donde cuida de sus 100 vacas, de las cuales sus padres elaboran queso que los venda de acuerdo al peso de los moldes. Cuenta que tiene pedidos de las diferentes ciudades cercanas, que son conocedores de su buena producción. Para cuidar de la calidad ella viaja 2 veces al mes, pues también crían ovejas de las cuales comercializa su carne, “hay meses, donde los pedidos sobrepasan mi producción, para abastecer tengo que comprar a otros ganaderos”, cuenta. Ahora tiene muchos pedidos y espera poder abastecer a sus clientes, pues su objetivo es industrializar su queso.
Este es su tercer crédito con kiva,y se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Denisse de recibir su apoyo; invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de varios moldes de queso para su negocio.
texts.en:
Denisse, who is thirty years old, is an admirable woman. She lives with her parents and siblings in her own home. 

Denisse works selling cheese and is studying Business Administration in a well-known university in the city. She has a farm on the hills of her town, where she cares for her 100 cows. Her parents make cheese from their milk for her to sell according to the weight of the molds.

She says she gets orders from different cities nearby, which know about her good products. To ensure quality, she travels twice per month, since they also raise sheep and sell their meat. "There are months when the orders surpass my production, so in order to meet demand I have to buy from other livestock farmers," she says. She currently has lots of orders and expects to be able to satisfy her customers, because her goal is to industrialize her cheese.

This is her third Kiva loan, and she is grateful for the financial support she receives in order to keep going, which is why she promises to pay her installments on time. If Denisse obtains the support she is requesting, she will invest the 500 soles in purchasing several cheese molds for her business.

loans.use: to buy several cheese molds.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo is a merchant is from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Nilo is a married man and a father of two children. Nilo sells various household goods and materials to the people in his place.

Nilo is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like slippers, shoes, tupperware, and kitchenware. With this he will be able to improve the variety of his store, which attracts more buyers. 

In the future, Nilo hopes of making his business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like slippers, shoes, tupperware, and kitchenware.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 54, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Helen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Helen hopes that her business will become big one day and dreams for a good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel is a 31-year-old married man. He has 2 children with ages 2 years and 4 years. He describes himself to be determined. 

Emanuel operates a bakery where he sells cakes and bread. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in an area good for business and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to diversify business products. 

Emanuel will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy cooking oil, wheat flour and other items for preparing cakes and bread. His business goal is to be a regional supplier of bakery products within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.  The previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy baking ingredients

loans.name: Choert's Group

texts.en:
Choert is 28 years old and lives with her husband and one son in a rural village of the Moung Russey district. Rice farming is the main source for her family’s income; she has been farming rice on a one-hectare area of farmland for about five years. The current business earns her family a daily income of about 18,000 KHR, but she is able to save 10,000 KHR each day.
 
This is the second loan for Choert’s group of two with VisionFund. With the successful first loan, she has been able to support her family. Now, she is leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria works hard to support her family. Hilaria is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Hilaria requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, buttons, zippers, etc. for her business.

Hilaria has been in this business for 8 years now.

Hilaria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, buttons, zippers, etc.for her business

loans.name: Lout's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Lout, 36, has three children in total, all of whom are dependents and still in school. Lout and her husband have been planting cassava and raising pigs for 16 years to make a living.

Lout is just with VisonFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Lout is going to use her portion to buy pesticides for her cassava and use a portion of it to spend on buying pig feed. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her cassava healthily and also hopes to fatten her pigs to better her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her cassava, and also feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 42-year-old married woman; she is running a business of milk sales with the support of her husband. She has been running this business for the past 12 years. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. She is a mother of two children and she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. 

In order to make bigger profits, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to grow her sales of milk. She hopes to get an increase in earnings and wishes to spend part of her revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en:
Nasra  is 27 years old and a married woman. She has been stitching clothes for the past three years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help continue the operations of her business, Nasra has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and laces in various colors to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 43-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

Riffat is a mother of two and is motivated to provide for them with the basic necessities of life including food, clothing and education.  To make her store fully stocked, Riffat has requested a loan for Rs 30,000, which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 22-year-old lady. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching clothes. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Her father is employed with a low salary income to meet the expenses of their household. Therefore, Azra is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

To cope with the increasing demands from her customers, Azra has now requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. 

Azra hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Koe Pyahu Group

texts.es:
14 son las mujeres que están trabajando en este grupo, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer como cada una de ellas se encuentra. Una persona que forma parte de este grupo es Nidia, quien en su encuesta mostró estar en un nivel medio de ingresos.
Nidia es una peluquera muy conocida en su barrio, siempre está con mucha clientela, ya que siempre atiende muy bien a sus clientas y eso es lo que mas les gusta. Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que hoy solicita la ayuda con un crédito para invertirlo en insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, tijeras, peines y demás, y de esa forma seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
There are fourteen women working in this group. They are completing the poverty elimination survey in order to know the situation of each member. Nidia is one of the people belonging to this group. Her survey showed her income level as intermediate. 

Nidia is a very well known hairdresser in her neighborhood. She always has lots of customers, because she always takes good care of her patrons and that is what they like the most. She is a very hard worker and a fighter, and currently she is requesting the help of a loan to invest in supplies for her hair salon, such as dyes, scissors, combs, and other items. This will allow her to continue working as she has been so far.

loans.use: to buy dyes, scissors, combs, and other supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee, 33 years old, is married, and they are blessed with three kids. She has managed a retail store for eight years. She is a very diligent person; she makes sure that she can give all the needs of her family. 

Haydee is requesting a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy one box of canned goods, sugar, soy sauce and spices for her store. 

Haydee hopes that her children finish their studies and that she can expand her business to sustain the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy one box of canned goods, sugar, soy sauce and spices for her store.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 34 years old and married with two children. She lives in Guinles, Polanco, Zamboanga Del Norte with her family. Her husband is a farmer – their main source of income – while she runs a ‘sari-sari’ store selling grocery items in the village. She has managed the store for four years and is able to support the needs of her children, especially sending them to school. 

She borrowed a loan of 3,000.00 PHP from Gata Daku MPC micro credit, which she had joined recently, in order to purchase feed, rice and corn grits for sale. Her dream of having a better living in the future is at hand with her attitude of a hard-working mother and determination.

loans.use: to purchase feed, rice and corn grits for sale

loans.name: Paul

texts.es: Paul es un hombre de 30 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de su madre. Paul se dedica a brindar transporte a las personas por la ciudad. Trabaja todos los días por horas programadas. Recorre todas las calles en busca de pasajeros que requieran ser trasladados a algún lugar específico y el se encarga de que lleguen a su destino sin ningún inconveniente y con total seguridad. Tiene un mototaxi propio desde hace 3 años, desde entonces a trabajado en esta actividad y por su gran habilidad para convencer a los pasajeros consigue buenas ganancias económicas. Desea comprar otro mototaxi para alquilarlo y de esta forma asegurar otro ingreso económico, aunque por ahora quiere refaccionar su mototaxi actual para que funcione de maravilla y con el dinero que obtiene de ello ir ahorrando para comprarse otro vehículo de trabajo y continuar en su lucha por el progreso de su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800, por tanto se siente agradecido con todas las personas que le brindan el préstamo que necesita para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará llantas nuevas y remodelará el tapizado y algunas otras piezas de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Paul is 30 years old, single, and lives at home with his mother. He works providing transportation services to people around his city and works every day on a fixed schedule. He drives around town looking for passengers who require transportation to a specific place, and he takes care of making sure they reach their destinations without inconvenience and with total safety. He has his own moto-taxi which he acquired 3 years ago, and since then has been working as a driver. Due to his great skill convincing passengers to ride with him, he has been very successful. He would like to buy another moto-taxi in order to rent it out, and this way secure another source of income. However, right now he needs to repair his current moto-taxi so it functions perfectly, and with the money he earns from it save in order to buy the other vehicle and continue fighting for the progress of his family.  

Paul is currently asking for a loan of 800 Soles, and he is very grateful for all of the people who have helped him with the loan he needs to complete his goals. He promises to comply with all loan repayments punctually. With this loan, he will buy new tires and remodel the covering of his taxi.

loans.use: to buy two tires and to pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Apsa

texts.en:
Apsa is 34 years old and married with four children who are in school.

Apsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, eggs, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

Apsa has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Apsa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items like sugar, eggs, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan, a rural villager from Kandal province's Ponhea Luer district, is 47 years old and married. He has six children, one of whom is still in school. He has earned a living through farming rice on two hectare of farmland for several years. Sophorn is able to save up to 20,000 KHR per day from his current business after deducting the expenses. 

This is the second-cycle loan for Sophorn with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. He successfully paid back the past loan, which has helped him better support his business with enough food. 

Now he is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for his son’s education. He highly hopes that this loan will enable his son to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee for his son's education.

loans.name: Sothorn

texts.en:
A citizen from the Battambang district of Battambang province, Sothorn is 59 years old and she is married with five children. She is a housewife, while her husband is boxing referee in a local area. 

Having been in this business for 20 years, Sothorn's husband is able to earn about US$13 per day and he manages to save about KHR3 each day after daily expenses.
 
Sothorn has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before. Now, she is applying as the first-time borrower with VisionFund to cover the entire tuition fee for her daughter’s education at a local university. 

She hopes this loan will enable her daughter to keep studying until graduation to get a good job so she can support and improve the family.

loans.use: To cover the entire tuition fees for her daughter’s education

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Imelda has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from farming rice.

In the future, Imelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lecirna

texts.en:
Lecirna is 53 years old, married and has eight children, two of whom are in school. 

Lecirna is engage in air conditioning business in the Philippines. Lecirna requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts and other materials for her business.

Lecirna has been in this business for 23 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lecirna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts and other materials for her business

loans.name: Wangi

texts.en:
Wangi just began working with Ruma on 25 July 2013 to run Ruma’s new business, serving cash-in and cash-out customers’ money to Ruma’s bank partner. As a new agent in Ruma, Wangi needs and hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to start his new business. Wangi wishes this new business to be the other source of his family’s income.

Wangi lives in Pesagi, Penebel, Bali, a rural area about four hours from Denpasar. Wangi is married, has one child, and lives with five persons in the family’s house. His wife who stand besides him in the photo always support his business.

Prior to joining Ruma, Wangi worked as a UPH manager and farmer.

loans.use: to buy start-up credits to process branchless banking products within the pilot period.

loans.name: Gladis Esmit

texts.es: Gladis, a sus 33 años de edad, es casada y madre de 1 hijo.  Debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales y a la difícil situación económica por la que atravesaba su familia, ella decidió buscar opciones para generar ingresos por cuenta propia, por eso, hace varios meses inició su propio negocio, vendiendo mercancía por encargo; esto la impulsó para disponer de un pequeño espacio de su casa, lo adecuó para poner un pequeño mostrador para exhibir los artículos y  así tener la posibilidad de vender mercancía a las personas que transitan por el lugar; de esta forma ha obtenido ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. Gladis es una mujer emprendedora, activa y se esfuerza día a día para sacar adelante su negocio, pues desea convertirlo en un gran almacén de ropa, que sea rentable y reconocido en el sector, para poder seguir progresando.  Esto la motiva para solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, ropa interior), aprovechando los descuentos que le realizan por compras de contado y  así poder ofrecer variedad de artículos que satisfagan los gustos de sus clientes; incrementando sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos, con lo que podrá brindar mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a sus familia.
texts.en:
Gladis, 33 years old, is married and has 1 son. Given the lack of employment opportunities and the difficult economic situation in which her family found itself, she decided to look for options to generate income on her own. As a result, a few months ago she began her own business selling clothing. She uses a small space in her house as her shop, which she fixed up to have a small counter and rack to display her products. She now has the opportunity to sell to people who pass by her home, and in this way earns enough income to help her husband with their home expenses. Gladis is an entrepreneurial woman, very active, who puts in a great deal of effort into growing and improving her business every day. She hopes to someday convert her business into a larger clothing store, recognized in her region. 

For this reason she is asking for a new loan, which she will invest in the purchase of merchandise (blouses, jeans, underwear), taking advantage of the discounts available for buying in bulk. This way, she will be able to offer a variety of items that satisfy her clients' needs. She will be able to improve her sales and therefore her income, with which she will be able to provide a greater level of wellbeing and quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy bulk merchandise (blouses, jeans, underwear)

loans.name: Seela

texts.en:
"Seela is 21 years old and single with no children. 
She has a small garden where she grows taro,banana and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. Seela needs a loan to buy a shovel, pickaxe, rake, vegetable seeds, fertilizer, barbed wire, and garden hose. 
She has been a member of SPBD 2013.Seela will use the profits from her sales to support her family financially."

loans.use: to buy a shovel, pickaxe, rake, vegetable seeds, fertilizer, barbed wire, and garden hose

loans.name: Dave

texts.en: Dave is 19 years old. He is married and has been a rice farmer for one year. Dave is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers and pay for labor cost during land preparation. The profits from the business will be used for the expansion of his farming. Despite his young age, Dave wants to save money for his family to have a good living condition and future education of his future children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor cost during land preparation.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is very thankful for the financial assistance given to her. It is helping a lot in her variety store as she was able to buy additional products and grocery items. Her loan is also assisting in the education of her children and their household expenses. Her variety store has been running for 13 years now and it keeps on growing. She also has a direct selling business for additional income. 

Susan would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Susan hopes for continuous growth in her business as well as in her spiritual life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of four children. Benedicta is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, Benedicta will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. In the future, Benedicta hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Many's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother of five children, Many is aged 51 living in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. Two of her children are still in school. To support her family, she has been working as a tailor in the village. Having been in this business for 20 years, she is able to earn about 15,000KHK per day to meet the family’s need. 
Many has been with VisionFund for three cycle. She completely paid back the past loans, which has helped her relieve family’s burden. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy a sewing machine for supporting her business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en: Age 44 and a resident from Srey Snom district of Kampong Cham province, Savy is married and blessed with four children. Now, she needs to support only two schoolchildren via five hectares of rice cropping. She has involved in current business for ages, earning about 25,000 KHR per day. Savy and her co-borrower, the second-time borrowers, are in the same group to get a new loan from VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). Her original loan has enabled her to timely support her crop on time and get back to her a good yield. For this cycle, Savy is seeking for 1,000,000 KHR and her joint borrower is applying for 400,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed, potash, and insecticide for her farmland. She highly believes that she can support her agribusiness on time and keep improving her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay the rent on the farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Loris

texts.en:
Loris is 56 years old, and he lives in Vanadzor city. He is married and has two children, who are grown up and already married. Loris has higher education in engineering. For many years he worked as head of production at a factory, but then it was closed. Since that time, Loris has been engaged in a trading business. His business is in a rented stall at the central wholesale market of Vanadzor. He sells women's clothes: trousers, skirts, dresses and blouses. All these he buys from Yerevan wholesale markets, once a month. His wife helps him greatly in his business.

Loris seeks a loan of 600.000 Armenian drams, to enlarge the assortment of women's clothes he has available for sale, especially the range of women's trousers.

loans.use: to enlarge the assortment of women's clothes he has available for sale, especially the range of women's trousers.

loans.name: Carlos Sebastian

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 26 años, está casado con Elva de 24, él cursó la escuela primaria y los conocimientos adquiridos allí le han ayudado a conseguir distintos trabajos para obtener el sustento diario. Carlos y su esposa viven en Latacunga una ciudad que actualmente está en pleno crecimiento, pues como la capital de la provincia Cotopaxi en Ecuador, forma parte de las más importantes ciudades del país. Es una ciudad conocida por su rica gastronomía en especial las  “Hallullas” galletas duras en forma de pan que son tradición en Ecuador, Bolivia y Chile y además los “quesos de hoja”, además de actividad ganadera y agrícola que se sustenta gracias al clima templado, frío y cálido húmedo. El índice de pobreza supera el 50% pero al menos la mayoría de sus habitantes cuentan con servicios básicos en su vivienda. 
Carlos heredó el espíritu emprendedor de su madre de quien aprendió la actividad de crianza de pollos para su posterior venta. Carlos sueña con tener su automóvil con el que se pueda movilizar a los pueblos aledaños a vender sus animales, pero para esto debe incrementar su producción, por lo cual requiere comprar pollos bebé para comenzar a criarlos y venderlos cuando hayan adquirido peso y tamaño, es por eso que requiere un préstamo para comprarlos y empezar a incrementar sus utilidades. La falta de oportunidades para obtener capital ha sido un gran obstáculo para el crecimiento de su negocio, sin embargo le recomendaron visitar Fundación Alternativa quienes gracias a la intervención de Kiva y sus inversionistas, pudieron brindarle a Carlos las facilidades para solicitar este crédito que le abrirá las puertas al crecimiento, estabilidad y obtención de sueños.
texts.en:
Carlos is 26 years old and is married to Elva who is 24 years old. He completed primary school and his studies have helped him to acquire various jobs that enable him to sustain his daily needs. Carlos and his wife live in Latacunga, a city that is currently growing very fast. This city is the capital of the Cotopaxi province of Ecuador, and is one of the most important cities in the country. It is known for its rich gastronomy, specifically "las hallullas", which are hard cookies in the form of bread - traditional in Ecuador, Bolivia, and Chile. The region is also known for its cheeses, in addition to its livestock and agricultural activities which are sustained due to its temperate climate. The level of poverty in this region exceeds 50%, however the majority of residents have at least basic services such as housing. 

Carlos inherited his entrepreneurial spirit from his mother who learned to raise chickens for later sale. Carlos dreams of having his own car with which he can move between villages, helping him with his animal sales. However, in in order to achieve this goal he must increase his production, and to do so must buy baby chickens and begin to raise them - selling them once they have grown and gained weight. It is for this reason that he is asking for this loan. The lack of opportunities to obtain working capital has been a large obstacle for the growth of his business, however he was recommended to visit Fundación Alternativa, which thanks to the support of Kiva and its investors, was able to offer Carlos the ability to ask for this loan. This loan will open the doors for his business to grow and stabilize, enabling Carlos to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy baby chickens

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, de 30 años, es madre de 3 niños y vive a lado de su esposo en una casa propia. Delia se dedica a la confección de ropa para damas. Tiene su pequeño pero muy productivo taller de costura el cual está ubicado en su propio hogar,las prendas que elabora son vendidas a los mercados de su ciudad. Lleva 11 años en este trabajo y recibe la ayuda de su hija. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que recibe ingresos económicos diarios, además le permite disponer de su tiempo para descansar cuando se siente agotada, está muy contenta con el apoyo financiero que ha obtenido hasta ahora por que le permiten seguir cumpliendo con su labor. Le gustaría más adelante tener un taller más amplio con todas las herramientas necesarias para realizar trabajos de gran magnitud. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 700, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente cada uno de los materiales que emplea en su trabajo como telas, hilos de colores, blondas, elásticos, botones, cierres, agujas.
texts.en:
Delia, 30 years old, is the mother of 3 children and lives next to her husband in her own home. Delia works making women's clothing. She has a small but very productive shop which is located in her home, and she sells her products at various markets in her city. She has been doing this work for 11 years, and receives help from her daughter. What she likes most about her job is that she makes money daily, and it also lets her manage her own time so she can rest when she is tired. She is very happy with the financial support that she has received in order to perform her work. She would like to continue to grow her business and have a larger shop one day, with all of the tools necessary to service large orders. 

Currently, Delia is asking for 700 Soles, in order to progressively buy more materials that she can use in her work such as fabric, colored thread, elastic, buttons, needles, and lace.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabric, colored thread, elastic, buttons, needles, and lace

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
Kuña Pora está empezando a trabajar en su primer ciclo, donde cada una está dando su mayor esfuerzo por aprender e ir capacitándose para mejorar. Todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza como medio de conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 3, es decir con ingresos buenos, pero es consciente de que debe seguir trabajando para mantenerlos. Entre el trabajo que ella hace comenta que confecciona sabanas, pantalones, fundas, etc. Es una persona muy sacrificada, que con su trabajo ayuda a su familia, dándoles lo que necesitan para el día a día.
La Sra. Maria solicita de este crédito para la compra  Telas de Tejidos, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Kuña Pora is starting to work on their first cycle, and every member is doing her best to learn and complete trainings in order to improve. They are all completing the poverty elimination survey as a means to know the situation of each member. 

Maria is one of its members. Her last survey showed her at a level three poverty level, which indicates good income, but she is aware that she needs to keep working to maintain it. Some of the work she does is making sheets, pants, pillow cases, etc. She is a very self-sacrificing person, who works to help her family and takes care of their daily needs. 

Maria is requesting this loan to purchase knit fabrics, which will help her define and implement her business plan, which in turn will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make sheets, pants, pillow cases, etc.

loans.name: Modulo 4 Group

texts.es:
El comité  Modulo 4 se conformó con la iniciativa de una de las integrantes, Actualmente se encuentran  en el 1er ciclo, con trece 13 integrantes, son de una colonia bastante alejada, aproximadamente a 70 km de Curuguaty, son de una zona eminentemente rural que está en desarrollo.
En su mayoría las integrantes se dedican a actividades agrícolas, como ser cría y venta de animales de corral, una de ellas es Lidia, quien solicita de este crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, y de esa forma poder seguir con su cría y su venta de animales. Esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que ella y sus compañeras están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The "Modulo 4" communal bank was formed at the initiative of one of the members. Now it is in its first loan cycle, with 13 members. They are from a fairly remote settlement, around 70 km from Curuguaty. They are from an area that is predominantly rural and in development. 

The majority of the members work in agriculture; raising and selling livestock. One of them is Lidia, who is requesting this loan to buy balanced feed for her animals so that she can continue raising and selling animals. She is very grateful for the opportunity that she and her fellow members are receiving.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for animals.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 61 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising cows in the Philippines. Ester is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and cows to raise.

Ester has been raising cows for 30 years and also earns additional income from farming coconut and selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and cows to raise

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is a 62-year-old woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business. She is also into a hog-raising venture. These are the sources of her income. Margarita is asking for a loan to buy piglets. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Glenda Licth

texts.es:
Doña Glenda es una mujer de 33 años de edad casada, emprendedora, luchadora y madre de una sola hija la cual vive con ellos. Ella se dedican en compañía de su conyugue a las diferentes actividades de cultivo y producción de granos básicos como ser: maíz y frijol siendo su principal actividad el café. Aprendió la agricultura hace muchos años siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar y a realizar las diferentes actividades como, limpieza, abono, corte, riego, etc. Sus cultivos están ubicados en la misma propiedad donde está su casa de habitación por lo que esto les permite dar una mejor y personalizada asistencia a sus cultivos. Doña Glenda tiene un grado de educación secundario completo graduándose como perito mercantil y contador público. Sus sueños son educar su hija para que tenga una mejor calidad de vida y que obtenga un nivel educativo universitario, formar un patrimonio sólido para su familia y hacer de sus cultivos atractivos para sus clientes ya que de esa manera ella podrá generara mejores ingresos para su familia y su hogar.

Doña Glenda actualmente solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 10 sacos de abono, 3 QQ de formula cafetalera, 4 litros de forti café ya que es necesario asistir y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos como también extenderlos para generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Glenda is 33 years old, married, and has one daughter who lives with her and her husband. She is entrepreneurial and a fighter. She works alongside her husband in many different agricultural activities, including the production of corn, beans, and coffee (her primary activity). She learned about agriculture many years ago from her parents, who taught her how to work and complete different tasks such as cleaning, fertilizing, cutting, and watering her fields. Her fields are located in the same region as her home, which enables her to give her crops better care and more personalized attention. Glenda has a secudary education and graduated as an accountant. Her dream is to educate her daughter so that she will have a better quality of life and obtain a university-level education. Glenda hopes to improve her family's economic situation by making her crops attractive for her clients, in this way generating greater income for her family and her home. 

Doña Glenda is currently asking for a loan from COMIXMUL to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer as well as other chemicals for her coffee crops. It is necessary to tend to and maintain her fields, as well as extend them, in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products for the cultivation of coffee

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 17 years now.

Lolita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance for her fishing boat.

In the future, she  would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance for her fishing boat

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a Liberian. She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city.  People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

Rebecca is 29 years old. She is married and has three children between 4 and 12 years old. Her children are currently living at home and attending school.  

Rebecca has had a small shop selling charcoal for the past five years now. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more charcoal for her business. On average, she works ten hours a day at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with a small amount of money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the money she makes. In the future, she would like to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 58 years old. He lives with his wife in Vanadzor city. His children are already married, and they live separately. Samvel graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the Historical department. Now he works as the director of the nearby village school, where he is also a schoolmaster of Armenian history. In addition, Samvel has several pupils who attend private courses that he gives at his flat, and he prepares them for the entrance examinations.

Samvel is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenain drams to buy a computer for developing his educational programs and methods of educating.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  San Expedito está en su ciclo número tres del programa de comité de mujeres, son 17 mujeres con grandes ansias de crecer y mejorar. Una de ellas es Nidia, quien hace comestibles y los vende y así está ayudando a su familia. Es una persona que no se cansa de luchar y dar a su familia lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Nidia solicita de este crédito para poder comprar insumos para seguir haciendo sus comidas y seguir ganándose así el sustento diario. Las señoras son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
texts.en:
This group is called San Expedido and is in its third cycle of the Committee for Women.  The group is made up of 17 ladies with a great desire to grow and improve.  Nidia is one of them and she makes food and sells it to help her family.  She is a person who doesn’t tire of working hard and provide her family with what they need each day.

Nidia is asking for this loan so she can buy ingredients and continue earning her daily sustenance.  These ladies are known for being hard workers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Claudelino

texts.es:
El Sr. Claudelino es comerciante, se dedica al macate (venta ambulante) hace varios año, por lo que ya tiene clientela formada y varias zonas en donde realiza su actividad, el es muy conocido por la buena calidad de sus productos.
 Tiene su casa propia edificada en terreno familiar y gracias a su trabajo, esfuerzo y dedicación logró comprarse una camioneta y una moto, vehículos que emplea en sus actividades laborales cotidianas.
El crédito solicitado es para compra de productos para la venta de championes, sobrecamas, edredones antialérgicos, etc. Y asi seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Claudelino’s a merchant.  He’s been a street vendor for many years so has a well-established regular clientele in several areas where he carries out his business.  He’s very well-known because of the good quality of his products.

He has a house of his own built on a family lot and thanks to his work, effort and dedication he succeeded in buying a pick-up truck and a motorcycle for himself, vehicles that he uses in his daily work activities.

The loan requested is to buy products like athletic shoes, bedspreads, anti-allergenic comforters, etc. to sell thus continuing with his sales.

loans.use: to buy sports shoes, bedspreads, anti-allergenic comforters, etc.

loans.name: Sila

texts.en: Silas is doing well in his business. He has borrowed a rider  school fee loan of Kshs 70000 to pay university fees for his younger brother, while he still servicing his business loan of the same amount. He anticipates getting profits from his business to repay the loan and support his siblings. He desires to invest in his siblings' education as he sees them flourish and established.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his younger brother

loans.name: Anne Bamitodjou's Group

texts.fr:
Anne Bamitadjou et Justine sont des voisines de longues dates et sollicitent aujourd'hui chacune un prêt auprès d'ALIDé.

Anne Bamitadjou, la représentante, est âgée de 52, mariée avec Ramane et a 2 enfants.

Elle exerce comme activité la vente de maïs et de fagots de bois.
Elle a besoin de ce crédit afin de se rendre au principal marché de sa ville pour acheter des quantités plus importantes et revendre à proximité de son domicile. Elle exerce cette activité depuis trente ans environ.

Avec les bénéfices elle pourra renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Anne Bamitadjou and Justine have been neighbors for a long time and are each requesting a loan from ALIDé today.

Anne Bamitadjou, the leader, is 52 years old, married to Ramane and has 2 children.

She sells corn and bundles of wood.

She needs this loan in order to go to the main market of her town to buy bigger quantities and resell close to her home. She has been in this business for about 30 years.

With the profits she will be able to strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and bundles of wood.

loans.name: Fatmata B

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has two children, aged 19 and 5 years. 

In 2001, Fatmata established her tailoring shop to be sewing ladies’ dresses and men's suits. She began her business because she would like to assist her husband in taking care of some domestic affairs. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy tailorring machine that can design cloths to her customers taste.She hopes that this loan will increase her profit by approximately Le 500,000. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to establish a tailoring school. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy tailorring machine that can design cloths to her customers taste.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pillow-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Lorena requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric and cotton to sell.

In the future, Lorena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials, such as fabric and cotton

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita es madre de 3 hijos, tiene 64 años de edad y es viuda. Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agropecuarias al lado de sus padres; gracias a esto, hoy en día se dedica a la cría, engorde y comercialización de cerdos; con lo cual ha generado ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar, pues toda la carga económica recayó sobre ella, luego del fallecimiento de su esposo. Es una mujer trabajadora, manifiesta que la edad no le impide realizar sus labores, por el contrario la hace sentir útil. Ella trabaja diariamente, alternando su actividad agropecuaria con la comercialización de pipetas de gas, con lo que se genera ingresos extras para mejorar la economía de su familia. Rita solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de lechones y concentrado, para darle continuidad a su negocio y poder lograr poco a poco una producción escalonada que le garantice ingresos mensuales estables, para tener la oportunidad de seguir ampliando su negocio y cubrir toda la demanda a mediano plazo, para evitar que sus clientes se vayan para la competencia, lo que afectaría directamente sus finanzas. Rita desea cumplir el sueño de ver su negocio fortalecido, que sea rentable, sostenible y perdurable en el tiempo, para dejar un buen legado a sus hijos y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
64-year old Rita has three children and is a widow. She has spent her whole life in the countryside where her parents taught her about farming. As a result of this background Rita today raises and sells pigs. The money she earns pays for basic household necessities as she is solely responsible for these items since the death of her husband. Rita says that her age doesn't prevent her from working hard; on the contrary, her work makes her feel useful. She goes to work every day alternating between her farm duties and her other job selling propane tanks. This is another way she earns money to improve her financial situation. 

Rita is seeking a loan to buy suckling pigs and special feed so that she can continue her business and gradually increase production so that she gets a stable monthly income. It will also give her the opportunity to grow her business and fill orders so that her customers won't go to her competitors. This would directly affect her finances.

Rita wishes to fulfill her dream of seeing her business become strong, profitable, and sustainable so that she can leave her children a good legacy and she herself can enjoy a better quality of life alongside her family.

loans.use: Buy suckling pigs and special feed

loans.name: Clarance

texts.en:
Clarance is married and has four adult children.

She lives in Mariakani, where she runs several businesses. She sells tomatoes on a wholesale basis. She also loves being around children. She started a day care for children and a nursery school for older children. She has three employees in her business and she has been running the business for the past five years. 

She has had precious loans with Milango and some of the loans were listed on Kiva. She repaid all her loans and she seeks another loan to purchase tables and chairs for her day care and nursery school. The major challenge for her business is pricing.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs for her day care and nursery school.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! Zainab is 35 years old and from Kandeh town Bo. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 4 and 10 years old. Two of her children are attending school. 

Zainab runs a palm oil business. She sells palm oil, nut oil and beans. She has been running this business for 8 years. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. Zainab says that her business is doing well.

Zainab has requested a loan in order to purchase food items including a gallon of palm oil, native rice and gari. The extra income from this loan will allow her to feed her children and increase her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food items including a gallon of palm oil, native rice and gari

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Yeabu from Kandeh town Bo, Southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 7 children between the ages of 12 and 30 years old. Four of her children are going to school.

Yeabu runs a Gari business; she sells gari at her house. She has been running this business for 3 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 8 hours per day. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to run her business and price inflation.

Yeabu has requested a loan in order to purchase more bag of gari. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her family's welfare. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of gari

loans.name: Marthalyn

texts.en:
Marthalyn lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 24 years old. She completed seventh grade and she is single, with two children, ages four and two. Only one of them is in school and they live at home.

For the past three years Marthalyn has been selling fashion slippers in the local market. She received a small amount of money from her mother to start her business and she learned the business from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit.

Marthalyn is requesting a loan to purchase more goods such as fashion slippers for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as fashion slippers for her business.

loans.name: Jonathan D.

texts.en:
Jonathan D. is glad to have his picture and personal information on the website of Kiva. He said, "This is to tell business stories to the world." Jonathan is a 48-year-old man who stopped his education right after he obtained a high school diploma. He decided to do business to make some money to improve his living conditions, so he asked and got a little money from his father to establish his business. Now he runs a shop which sells cement in the area of Gbarnga, which is the capital city of Bong County and is well known as the centre point of Liberia. He requested a 100,000 LRD loan to buy more cement for his business.
 
Jonathan D. mentioned his hard work and his seriousness gained him this business two years ago. His goods are always brought to his shop by truck, and a problem he faces is the road conditions to the shop. He opens his shop by 8am and closes by 6pm from Monday to Saturday. His customers comment most of the time about how helpful his business has been. He is the only one who cannot go out of stock,  his distribution to his customers is always on time, and he sells his cement at a minimal price. He is happy about his business because the business makes him popular and gives him more money.  

Jonathan D.is married and his wife stays at home. They have six children between the ages of 31 and 15. Among the six, only two are living at home and attending grade school, while the rest of his children are living on their own and attending some college. He is the one who assists them with money for their schooling. 

He thanks BRAC Liberia for their support.

loans.use: to buy more cement for his business.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 38 years old, married with three children between the ages of 10 and 17 who are in school and living at home in the West Point area, one of the most populated and best-known markets in Montserrado County that is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market. She is an eighth grade dropout, and has been selling palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, peppers, etc in the local market over the past one year. She uses a taxi most of the time; she really faces problem during the rainy season because she does not have good selling spot in the local market. 

Linda is requesting a loan to increase her sales by buying more palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, peppers, etc. Her dream is to build a house for her children.  She is happy of her business because she makes more money.

loans.use: to increase her sales by buying more palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Lamin from Waterloo, eastern area in Freetown. He is married with two children ages one and 19.  In 2001, Lamin established his retail business. He began his business because he wanted to create a permanent source of income to support his children. Lamin works seven days a week from eight in the morning through seven at night. His major business challenges are the high cost of transportation and slow sales during the rainy season. 

Lamin is requesting a loan to purchase variety of local goods such as calabash and sieve for resale. He hopes that the extra income from his loan will allow him to empower his children and increase his business. In the future, Lamin plans to expand his local goods store. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase variety of local goods such as calabash and sieve for resale.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia is a Liberian. She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for their beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

Felecia is a widow, 49 years old, and has seven children between the ages of 11 to 27.  Only two are currently living at home and attending school. She owns a table market that has been selling fashion clothes, body cream, bath soap, etc., for the past two years now. She will use the loan to purchase more goods such as fashion clothes, body cream, bath soap, etc., to resell.  

On average, she works eight hours at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started this business by selling for her mother. Most often she uses a taxi to reach her goods at her table market. She cites the bad location of her business in the local market as her biggest challenge. Her dream is to own a shop.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as fashion clothes, body cream, bath soap, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Iddi

texts.en:
Iddi is 30 years old. He lives in Mombasa, Kenya where he owns a cereals shop. He also has another shop where he sells clothes. Iddi started the business three years ago and it is doing great. He is employed formally so he has someone managing the business for him. 
Iddi is a married man with two children. He knew about Milango through a friend who invited him to join and so he joined. He now seeks a loan to buy a weighing machine and some cereals for sale. He faces challenges at times in the business but he has chosen not to share with Milango. The extra income that he will raise from the business will pay school fees for his children and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a weighing machine and some cereals

loans.name: Benendeta

texts.en:
Benendeta, who is 77 years old, is a widowed mother of seventeen children, who are not in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is medication.

Benendeta has operated a retail shop business for the past twenty years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She faces a challenge of delayed payments by people who borrow items in her business and delay to pay. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and oil.

loans.name: Musu Juliana

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Juliana. She is married and has one child, aged 22. In 2000, Juliana established her patient medicine business. She began her business to enable her to independently provide for her basic needs. Her business is located on the outskirts of town and her main customers are all classes of people. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Juliana requires a loan in order to buy patient drugs. She hopes that this loan shall increase her stock level and hence will have additional income. 

In the future, Juliana plans to build a house and to transform her drug store into a pharmacy. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy patient drugs.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, Umazi has operated a food kiosk business, selling maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. Umazi dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. Umazi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is married with three children and all her children go to school. She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She works in a shop six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves, transportation and seasonality. She aspires to own a delivery van for ease in transportation and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills and medications.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Chiyongul

texts.ru:
Чиёнгул молодая девушка в возрасте 23-х лет. Она еще не замужем и живет с родителями, старшим братом и невесткой в районе Хамадони. Ее брат и отец уехали на заработки в заграницу и в доме остались только женщины. Чиёнгул после окончания школы начала сама зарабатывать на жизнь. Она у своих подруг научилась шить платья и вот уже четыре года как она успешно занимается этим делом. Она шьет красиво и качественно. Количество ее клиентов увеличиваются и поэтому ей в деятельности помогает невестка - жена брата. 
Чиёнгул сейчас обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку. Она собирается расширить свою деятельность. Она любит свою работу и получает за свои услуги хорошую прибыль.
texts.en:
Chiyongul is a young woman of 23 years. She is not yet married and lives with her parents, her older brother and his wife in the Hamadoni region. Her brother and father left to work abroad and only women remain in the house. After graduating high school, Chiyongul began to earn a living. 

From her friends, she learned to sew dresses and over the last four years she has successfully engaged in this business. She sews beautifully and with good quality. The quantity of her customers has increased and therefore she is helped in her work by her sister-in-law - her brother's wife.  

Chiyongul has now applied for a loan to buy a new sewing machine. She is going to expand her operations. She loves her work and earns a good profit from her services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing activities

loans.name: Blanca Inés

texts.es: Blanca tiene 52 años de edad y vive con su esposo y su único hijo. Hace varios años se dedica a ser comerciante independiente, inicialmente comenzó vendiendo mercancía por encargo, pero viendo los buenos resultados que obtuvo, decidió adecuar un espacio en su casa y montó su propio almacén, donde ofrece ropa, artículos para bebé, ropa interior, entre otros; con esto ha logrado adquirir los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Blanca es una señora humilde, amable y muy trabajadora, manifiesta que le gusta su labor, porque puede generar ingresos, manejando su propio tiempo y a la vez puede estar pendiente de su hogar. Blanca con el fin de hacer crecer su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (blusas, camisetas, jeans, ropa interior, medias) y una vitrina para exhibir los productos; así le dará mejor imagen al negocio y tendrá más variedad de productos disponible para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de los clientes; esto se verá reflejado en el aumento de sus ingresos por ventas, lo que le ayudará a seguir avanzando y lograr cumplir el sueño de ampliar su negocio, que sea rentable y reconocido para que le brinde la oportunidad de mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar y tener un futuro más próspero para disfrutarlo al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is 52 years old and lives with her husband and her only son. She has been in the independent sales trade for several years. Initially, she began selling merchandise on order, but after seeing the good results she obtained, she decided to set up her own shop in her house where she sells clothes, baby items, and undergarments, among others. With this, she has managed to acquire enough resources to contribute to her household economy. 

Blanca is a humble, friendly, and very hardworking woman. She says she likes her job because she can generate income, manage her own time, and at the same time, she can keep an eye on her home. In order to make her business grow, Blanca is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale merchandise (blouses, shirts, jeans, undergarments, pantyhose) and a display cabinet to exhibit her products. This will give a better image to her business and she will have a wider range of products available to meet the tastes and needs of her customers. This will be reflected in increased sales revenue, which will help her move forward and achieve her dream of expanding her business, making it profitable and well known so that she can be given the opportunity to improve the economic stability of her home and have a brighter future to enjoy at her family’s side.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (blouses, shirts, jeans, undergarments, pantyhose) and a display cabinet to exhibit her products.

loans.name: Mayanmu

texts.en:
Mayanmu is 25 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea. It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

She is married. She completed 4th grade before establishing her business five years ago by selling for her older sister. She started this business with the little money given to her by her older sister, opening a table market to sell body cream, soap, grease and perfume. She learned this way of selling from her older sister. She likes how people respond to her business, and mostly, she enjoys the interaction of her customers. She sells nine hours each day from Monday to Saturday.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, soap, grease and perfume for her business. Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, soap, Greece, and perfume for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica lives in the AirPort area of Margibi County. She is 38 years old and married with three children between the ages of 7 and 22, only two of whom are in school and live at home. Her husband works with Firestone. She completed 8th grade before starting her business, which she has had for the past seven years now, selling rice, pepper, vita, sugar and salt in the local market. She works for eight hours from Monday to Saturday. She described herself as a hardworking business woman. She is requesting a loan to purchase more onions, rice, pepper, vita, etc. for her business. Her plans are to build her house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, pepper, vita, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Gemma

texts.es:
La Gemma tiene 48 años, ella y su marido tiene un local comercial de venta de cosméticos en el mercado desde el año 2010. Gracias al trabajo que están  realizando pueden mantenerse. Gemma  ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta con sus compromisos. 
Solicita este crédito para  la compra de un mueble para exhibir sus productos. Agradece por la  oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Gemma is 48-years-old; she and her husband have had a commercial locale in the market since 2010 where she sells cosmetics.  Thanks to the work they’ve been doing they are able to support themselves.  Gemma has shown herself to be a very responsible honest person with her commitments.

She’s requesting this loan to buy a piece of furniture to display her products.  She’s grateful for the opportunity she’s getting since it will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
